text: The Thirteen Buddhist Sites of Kamakura（鎌倉十三佛霊場, Kamakura jūsan butsu reijō）are a group of 13 Buddhist sacred sites in Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan. The temples are dedicated to the Thirteen Buddhas. ==Directory== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Number !! Temple !! Dedication |- | 1. || Myōōin 明王院 || Fudō-myōō |- | 2. || Jōmyō-ji 浄妙寺 || Shaka Nyorai |- | 3. || Hongaku-ji 本覚寺 || Monju Bosatsu |- | 4. || Jufuku-ji 寿福寺 || Fugen Bosatsu |- | 5. || Ennō-ji 円応寺 || Jizō Bosatsu |- | 6. || Jōchi-ji 浄智寺 || Miroku Bosatsu |- | 7. || Kaizō-ji 海蔵寺 || Yakushi Nyorai |- | 8. || Hōkoku-ji 報国寺 || Kannon Bosatsu |- | 9. || Jōkōmyō-ji 浄光明寺 || Seishi Bosatsu |- | 10. || Raigō-ji 来迎寺 || Amida Nyorai |- | 11. || Kakuon-ji 覚園寺 || Ashuku Nyorai |- | 12. || Gokuraku-ji 極楽寺 || Dainichi Nyorai |- | 13. || Jōju-in || Kokūzō Bosatsu |} ==See also== * Thirteen Buddhas Category:Buddhist temples in Kanagawa Prefecture Category:Buddhist pilgrimage sites in Japan
title: Thirteen Buddhist Sites of Kamakura
